page.title: 13FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (8).
page.content: {Families and farming.}The family who has been living on their farm for the longest time is the Jones family.They have farmed Badharlick for at least the past 135 years.The Grylls family have farmed Newton for over 100 years. Eight of the other farms have belonged to the same family for two or three generations,(31 to 73 years). Home Farm, Gospenheale and Tresanber have been farmed by the same families for only 15 years, while the Tregeare Estate changed hands only 2 years ago. {Farmhouses.} Tredidon farmhouse is over 600 years old and Dinners is 500 years old. Tredundle is a 400 year old house. Eleven farmhouses are 80 t0 300 years old and Tresanber farmhouse was built 7 years ago.
